H0.text: what are the important holidays of islam. Eid al-Fitr

H1.text: what are the important holidays of islam. Eid al-Adha

H2.text: what are the important holidays of islam. Laylat al-Mi'raj

H3.text: what are the important holidays of islam. Ramadan

A4.text: Eid al-Fitr is celebrated by Muslims worldwide as it marks the end of the month-long, dawn-to-dusk fasting (sawm) during Ramadan.

A5.text: Eid al-Fitr (Arabic: عيد الفطر, romanized: ʿĪd al-Fiṭr, lit. 'Festival of Breaking the Fast') is the first of the two main festivals in Islam, the other being Eid al-Adha.

A6.text: Eid al-Adha is also called the Greater or Large Eid (Arabic: العيد الكبير, romanized: al-ʿĪd al-Kabīr).

A7.text: The lunar calendar is approximately eleven days shorter than the solar calendar.
